entry.string: The xarTelnet module allows you to connect to any device/protocol that supports telnet. Provided are a set of API to help module developers come up with creative ways to use.
entry.translation: Zee xerTelnet mudoole-a elloos yuoo tu cunnect tu uny defeece-a/prutucul thet sooppurts telnet. Um de hur de hur de hur. Prufeeded ere-a a set ooff EPI tu help mudoole-a defelupers cume-a up veet creeteefe-a veys tu use-a.

entry.string: You must configure xarTelnet before you can successfully use it. The configuration sets the default host, port, etc that will be used if none other is specified. This is a utility module, there are no user controls. Module writers can use the follow method to provide thier programs with telnet functionality:
entry.translation: Yuoo moost cunffeegoore-a xerTelnet beffure-a yuoo cun sooccessffoolly use-a it. Um de hur de hur de hur. Zee cunffeegooreshun sets zee deffoolt hust, purt, itc thet veell be-a used iff nune-a oozeer is speceeffied. Thees is a uteelity mudoole-a, zeere-a ere-a nu user cuntruls. Um gesh dee bork, bork! Mudoole-a vreeters cun use-a zee fulloo methud tu prufeede-a theeer prugrems veet telnet fooncshuneleety:

entry.string:
if( (dollar sign)socket = xarmodapifunc('xartelnet','user','connect', NULL))
{
    (dollar sign)write = "This is an example command, for web browsing use GET / HTTP/1.0nn";
    xarmodapifunc('xartelnet','user','write',array('input' => (dollar sign)write, 
                                'socket' => (dollar sign)socket));
    (dollar sign)results = xarmodapifunc('xartelnet','user','read',array('input' => xarmodgetvar('xartelnet','prompt'), 
                                    'socket' => (dollar sign)socket));
    xarmodapifunc('xartelnet','user','disconnect',(dollar sign)socket);
}
xarTelnet expects to recieve an array containing two variables, input and socket. You must pass the socket to use and input contains, for the read function, the text to stop reading at, or for the write function, what to write.

In the future xarTelnet will become scriptable.
entry.translation:
if( (dollar sign)socket = xarmodapifunc('xartelnet','user','connect', NULL)) { (dollar sign)write = "Thees is un ixemple-a cummund, fur veb brooseeng use-a GET / HTTP/1.0nn"; xarmodapifunc('xartelnet','user','write',array('input' => (dollar sign)write, 'socket' => (dollar sign)socket)); (dollar sign)results = xarmodapifunc('xartelnet','user','read',array('input' => xarmodgetvar('xartelnet','prompt'), 'socket' => (dollar sign)socket)); xarmodapifunc('xartelnet','user','disconnect',(dollar sign)socket); }
xerTelnet ixpects tu receeefe-a un errey cunteeening tvu fereeebles, inpoot und sucket. Yuoo moost pess zee sucket tu use-a und inpoot cunteeens, fur zee reed fooncshun, zee text tu stup reedeeng et, oor fur zee vreete-a fooncshun, vhet tu vreete-a.

In zee footoore-a xerTelnet veell becume-a screepteble-a.

entry.string: You can do the following from the menu:
entry.translation: Yuoo cun du zee fullooeeng frum zee menoo:

entry.string: Modify Config -- From here, you can configure the settings.
entry.translation: Mudeeffy Cunffeeg -- Frum here-a, yuoo cun cunffeegoore-a zee setteengs.

entry.string: Test Connnection -- Test the connection settings.
entry.translation: Test Cunnnecshun -- Test zee cunnecshun setteengs.

entry.string: There are no included blocks with the xartelnet Module
entry.translation: Zeere-a ere-a nu inclooded blucks veet zee xertelnet Mudoole
